basics.name: Xingjian(Siny) Zhang 张行健
basics.summary: M.Sc. student in Mechanical Engineering at National University of Singapore with research interests in multi-agent deep reinforcement learning, human–robot interaction, and generative AI. Experienced in machine learning, control systems, and computer vision processing. Passionate about music production.

work.name: SMART, Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
work.position: Research Intern, Mens, Manus and Machina (M3S)
work.summary: Leveraged Transformer architectures within a Generative Adversarial Imitation Learning (GAIL) framework to predict sequential personal educational and career trajectories based on expert demonstrations.

work.name: A*STAR Centre for Frontier AI Research (CFAR)
work.summary: Initiate research on “Robust Reflective Planning with Generative Physical Simulation for Long Horizon Manipulation”, focusing on test-time constraints and physical generative models through RL.

Activities.summary: Organized commemorative events including the 20th Anniversary Commemorative Evening and more than 20 different performances across universities and local communities. Additionally, produced campus anniversary song showcased in HIT History Museum.

awards.title: Mathematical Contest in Modeling (MCM)
awards.summary: Finalist in MCM 2022 (Top 1.3% Global), First author

publications.name: Learning-based Stage Verification System in Manual Assembly Scenarios (Submitted)
publications.publisher: International Conference on Smart and Advanced Manufacturing
publications.summary: Developed and implemented a learning-based stage verification system to improve manual assembly accuracy in industrial scenarios through 1 stereo camera.

publications.name: Attention-Based Learning for 3D Informative Path Planning
publications.summary: Applied attention mechanisms to enhance 3D informative path planning for robotic applications.

publications.name: COMPASS: Cooperative Multi-Agent Persistent Surveillance using Spatio-Temporal Attention Network
publications.summary: Developed a novel spatio-temporal attention network for coordinated multi-agent surveillance, demonstrating improved uncertainty reduction, scalability, and robustness.

projects.name: COMPASS: Cooperative Multi-Agent Persistent Surveillance
projects.summary: Developing a spatio-temporal attention network using multi-agent reinforcement learning and Gaussian processes on graph structures for persistent surveillance of dynamic targets.
highlights: Evaluated in simulated environments using AirSim (UE5)

projects.name: Hand-tracking and Object Detection for Verification in Assembly
projects.summary: Integrated an LSTM-based gesture recognition system with a YOLO-based object detection system for stage positioning and error detection during assembly tasks.

projects.name: Collaborative Motion Control of Dual Robots
projects.summary: Implemented real-time trajectory tracking and pose estimation using Cartographer, Kalman filtering, and integrated sensor communication via CAN and I2C for dual-robot coordination.
